meanings.definition: Sharpen or refine (a blade or tool)
meanings.sent1: He used a stone to hone the knife to make it sharp.
meanings.sent2: She always hones her scissors before starting a new sewing project.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to hone a spoon, but it didn't work well.
meanings.sent4: She hones her skills like a sculptor shaping a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the blade being honed echoed through the workshop.

meanings.sent1: Studying regularly can help hone your understanding of the subject.
meanings.sent2: The coach wanted to hone the team's strategy for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent3: He tried to hone his pencil with a rock, which was not very effective.
meanings.sent4: Her feedback helped hone his presentation into a powerful message.
meanings.sent5: The intense training session honed their skills to perfection.

meanings.definition: To focus or improve (skills or abilities)
meanings.sent1: Practicing daily can help hone your piano playing skills.
meanings.sent2: She decided to hone her writing abilities by taking a creative writing class.
meanings.sent3: He tried to hone his soccer skills by playing with his eyes closed.
meanings.sent4: The challenging project helped hone her problem-solving abilities.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's guidance helped hone his leadership skills over time.
